div.p: One of the shortcomings of blogs as a technology is that (at least from a netiquette point-of-view) you can't just start a conversation with someone about any topic where there isn't a blog post for that topic already.

(Sure you could post off-topic in the comments of some post. Or you could address a blog post, on your own blog, to a person and hope they notice it and reply. Neither seems to "work" very well though, if at all.)
Twitter (a popular microblogging service, which made microblogging mainstream) is somewhat an improvement with that respect, where you can easily start a (public) conversation.

To do so on Twitter, you simply address the message to them by putting their username with a "@" symbol in front of it first, and then write your message. Messages in this style will show up in their "replies" feed. For example:

pre.code: @reiver Do you know how the neocortex works?

div.p: (This will message will show up in the "replies" feed of the Twitter user with the username "reiver".)
